com.yantra.yfc.rcp

Class YRCTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCTimer

  • public class YRCTimer
extends java.lang.Object
    YRCTimer is an utlity class which enables to log timings.

    Usage: YRCTimer.start("A"); // Here A's should length should not be greater than 2000; YRCTimer.end("A","Message"); Here Message's should length should not be greater than 2000;

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public static void start(java.lang.String key)
        Call this method to start the timer.
        Parameters:
        key - should not be null

      • start

        public static void start(java.lang.String formid,
                         java.lang.String identifier)
        Parameters:
        formid - is the formid of a screen which requires any timing information to be captured
        identifier - is a unique identifier like api name , model namespace name , page id ,rule id etc

      • end

        public static void end(java.lang.String key,
                       java.lang.String message)
        Call this method to end the timer. If timer is not started then it does nothing.
        Parameters:
        key - should not be null
        message - can be null

      • end

        public static void end(java.lang.String formid,
                       java.lang.String identifier,
                       java.lang.String operation,
                       java.lang.String message)
        Parameters:
        formid - - It is the formid of the screen which requires timing information to be captured. In case of wizards it is the wizard id.
        identifier- - the same identifier used to start the timer
        operation - - It is some general information ,only to improve the readability of the log entries. Ex:"Api Complete", "Set model", "Get Target Model".
        message - - Any message the user requires. "message" can even be additional variables the user wants to capture at the end of the timer .

      • cleanMap

        public static void cleanMap()

      • end

        public static void end(java.lang.String formId,
                       java.lang.String identifier,
                       java.sql.Timestamp timestamp,
                       java.lang.String operation,
                       java.lang.String message)
        This method is overloaded specifically for API's , to make the key unique.
        Parameters:
        formId - is the formid of the screen
        identifier - is the API name, the same one used to start the timer.
        timestamp - is the timestamp captured and stored just before making call to start() of the timer
        operation - is YRCTimerConstants.API_COMPLETE
        message - is any valid string , which the developer wants to see in the log file when the API completes.
